application_metadata.name: CBACT01C - Account Data Reader and Display
application_metadata.description: Batch data extraction and reporting utility for account information that reads and displays complete account records for verification, reporting, and administrative purposes

business_entities.name: Account
business_entities.description: Core account entity containing financial and administrative information for customer accounts

attributes.name: account_id
attributes.description: Unique identifier for each account record, serves as primary key

attributes.name: active_status
attributes.description: Indicates whether the account is currently active or inactive (typically 'A' for active, 'I' for inactive)

attributes.name: current_balance
attributes.description: Current monetary balance of the account, can be positive or negative (10 digits + 2 decimal places)

attributes.name: credit_limit
attributes.description: Maximum credit amount allowed for the account (10 digits + 2 decimal places)

attributes.name: cash_credit_limit
attributes.description: Maximum cash advance amount allowed for the account, typically lower than credit limit (10 digits + 2 decimal places)

attributes.name: open_date
attributes.description: Date when the account was first opened

attributes.name: expiration_date
attributes.description: Date when the account expires or needs renewal, may be blank for accounts without expiration

attributes.name: reissue_date
attributes.description: Date when the account was last reissued or renewed, used for tracking account lifecycle events

attributes.name: current_cycle_credit
attributes.description: Total credit transactions for current billing cycle, resets at each billing cycle (10 digits + 2 decimal places)

attributes.name: current_cycle_debit
attributes.description: Total debit transactions for current billing cycle, resets at each billing cycle (10 digits + 2 decimal places)

attributes.name: address_zip_code
attributes.description: ZIP or postal code associated with account address, used for geographic and regulatory purposes

attributes.name: group_id
attributes.description: Identifier linking account to specific group or category for classification and reporting

business_rules.name: Sequential Account Processing
business_rules.description: All account records must be processed sequentially from beginning to end of the account dataset
business_rules.logic: Process all account records in sequential order without filtering or selection criteria
conditions: No end-of-data condition has been reached
actions: Read next account record
Display complete account information
Continue until all records are processed

business_rules.name: Account Balance Handling
business_rules.description: Account balances can be positive or negative values representing credit or debit positions
business_rules.logic: Current balance is stored as signed numeric field allowing both positive (credit) and negative (debit) values
conditions: Balance includes two decimal places for precision
actions: Display balance with appropriate sign
Maintain precision to two decimal places

business_rules.name: Credit Limit Management
business_rules.description: Each account has two distinct credit limits: regular credit limit and cash credit limit
business_rules.logic: Cash credit limit is maintained separately from regular credit limit and typically set at lower amount
conditions: Both limits are defined as signed numeric fields
Cash credit limit typically lower than regular credit limit
actions: Store and display both credit limit types
Allow independent management of each limit type

business_rules.name: Billing Cycle Tracking
business_rules.description: Current cycle credit and debit amounts track financial activity within the current billing cycle
business_rules.logic: Current cycle amounts accumulate transactions during billing period and reset at cycle boundaries
actions: Track credit transactions in current cycle credit field
Track debit transactions in current cycle debit field
Reset both fields at billing cycle end

business_rules.name: Account Lifecycle Tracking
business_rules.description: Account lifecycle is tracked through open date, expiration date, and reissue date
business_rules.logic: Three date fields track when account was opened, when it expires, and when it was last reissued
conditions: Expiration and reissue dates are optional
actions: Record account opening date at creation
Track expiration date for accounts with renewal requirements
Update reissue date when account is renewed

business_rules.name: Account Grouping
business_rules.description: Accounts can be assigned to groups for classification and reporting purposes
business_rules.logic: Group identifier links account to specific category or organizational grouping
actions: Assign group ID when categorization is needed
Use group ID for reporting and analysis

validations.rule: Must be 11-digit numeric value and unique across all accounts
Must be single character, typically 'A' for active or 'I' for inactive
Must be numeric with exactly 2 decimal places, can be positive or negative
Must be numeric with exactly 2 decimal places
Must be numeric with exactly 2 decimal places, typically less than or equal to credit limit
Must be valid date in 10-character format
Must be valid date in 10-character format when provided
Must be valid date in 10-character format when provided
Must be numeric with exactly 2 decimal places
Must be numeric with exactly 2 decimal places
Must be 10-character postal code format when provided

workflows.name: Account Data Extraction Process
workflows.description: Sequential workflow to extract and display all account records from the system

steps.action: Establish connection to account data source
Retrieve next account record in sequence
Display complete account record with all fields
Close connection to account data source

integrations.name: Account Data Repository
integrations.purpose: Primary source of account information for extraction and reporting
data_exchanged: Account records with complete account details

actions: read
extract
report
read
extract
report
read
extract

authentication_requirements: Data access permissions for account repository

error_handling.condition: Unable to establish connection to account data source
error_handling.business_impact: Account data extraction cannot proceed, reporting unavailable
error_handling.suggested_action: Verify data source availability and access permissions, retry operation

error_handling.condition: Error reading account record during sequential processing
error_handling.business_impact: Incomplete account data extraction, potential data integrity issues
error_handling.suggested_action: Check data source integrity, log error details, notify system administrator

error_handling.condition: Unable to properly close connection to account data source
error_handling.business_impact: Potential resource leak, may affect subsequent processing
error_handling.suggested_action: Log error, verify system resources, investigate data source status

error_handling.business_impact: Normal completion of data extraction, all records processed
error_handling.suggested_action: Complete processing and close connections normally

reports.name: Complete Account Data Report
reports.description: Comprehensive listing of all account records with complete field details for verification and administrative purposes

user_messages.message: START OF EXECUTION OF PROGRAM CBACT01C
user_messages.context: Program initialization - indicates beginning of account data extraction process

user_messages.message: END OF EXECUTION OF PROGRAM CBACT01C
user_messages.context: Program completion - indicates successful completion of account data extraction process
Data source connection failure - unable to establish connection to account data repository
Data retrieval failure - error occurred while reading account record during sequential processing
Data source disconnection failure - unable to properly close connection to account data repository
Critical error termination - program ending abnormally due to unrecoverable error condition

data_flows.name: Account Data Extraction Flow
data_flows.description: Sequential flow of account data from repository to output display
transformations: Format numeric fields for display with appropriate decimal places
Format date fields for consistent presentation
Apply field labels for human readability
Add record separator lines between account records

business_constraints.description: Account identifiers must be unique across entire account dataset
business_constraints.impact: Ensures each account can be uniquely identified and prevents duplicate account records

business_constraints.description: All monetary amounts must maintain exactly 2 decimal places for cent precision
business_constraints.impact: Ensures accurate financial calculations and reporting without rounding errors

business_constraints.description: Cash credit limit is typically lower than regular credit limit
business_constraints.impact: Reflects business policy that cash advances have more restrictive limits than regular credit

business_constraints.description: Current cycle credit and debit amounts reset at billing cycle boundaries
business_constraints.impact: Ensures accurate tracking of transaction activity within defined billing periods

business_constraints.description: Account open date is mandatory, but expiration and reissue dates are optional
business_constraints.impact: Allows flexibility for different account types while ensuring creation date is always known

business_constraints.description: All account records must be processed in sequential order without filtering
business_constraints.impact: Ensures complete data extraction and prevents selective or partial reporting
